instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Board was corroded around <RESISTOR>R5150</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U8160</CHIP>, all those chips were worked on and fixed, board worked fine for a few days and now it is back with <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing, diode mode here is correct.

PPBUS 8.6V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.3V

When I Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> there is a drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Do you note pulse on all big coils?
Check <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: No pulse board climbs up to 0.021A and stays there, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> reballed same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> pulses, you should note a pulse at least on 5V coil.
If <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> also pulses, then check other coils for pulse too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: Turns out now <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is missing, I still get a pulse starts at 3.4V then drops to 0V on <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> when I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: No, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is no longer pulsing when I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Then you have PCH related issue.
Check its basic signals, many times mentioned on the forum.
